docs.snippet: Week Ended April 18, 1947 The Canadian free dollar, after a show of fair strength in the preceding week, slumped off sharply last week in a dive to 91.12 cents, a new low since it was adjusted to parity with the American dollar last July. Foreweek...
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended April 18, 1947 The Canadian free dollar, after a show of fair strength in the preceding week, slumped off sharply last week in a dive to 91.12 cents, a new low since it was adjusted to parity with the American dollar last July. Foreweek trades were reported at 93.75 cents, but Friday's final of 91.50 cents revealed a loss of 1 5/8 cents from the preceding week.

docs.snippet: Ralph Blakelock was born a hundred years ago this year (Oct. 15, 1947) and to celebrate the event the Whitney Museum of American Art, 10 West Eighth Street, has arranged an exhibition of the American painter's work, preparing it in collaboration with...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ralph Blakelock was born a hundred years ago this year (Oct. 15, 1947) and to celebrate the event the Whitney Museum of American Art, 10 West Eighth Street, has arranged an exhibition of the American painter's work, preparing it in collaboration with City College, which also marks this year the hundredth anniversary of its existence.
docs.abstract: Latin-Amer paintings and drawings, Knoedler's benefit exhibit

headline.main: Blakelock's Birthday Marked By Exhibition at the Whitney; Excellent Selection of Canvases by Noted American Artist Opens at Museum -- Knoedler's Show to Aid College

docs.snippet: The Question House at the Bronx Zoo opens tomorrow, ready for any poser from young visitors. Boys and girls are invited to take their questions to the experts. Open weekdays from 1 to 5 P.M., Saturday and Sunday, 1 to 5:30. The hundred millionth...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Question House at the Bronx Zoo opens tomorrow, ready for any poser from young visitors. Boys and girls are invited to take their questions to the experts. Open weekdays from 1 to 5 P.M., Saturday and Sunday, 1 to 5:30. The hundred millionth visitor to the Zoo is expected to pass through the turnstiles some time this week-end.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., April 25 -- Representatives of the five great powers conferred today with Trygve Lie, Secretary General of the United Nations, to fix the procedure necessary to get the special session of the General Assembly under way Monday.

docs.snippet: GUATEMALA, April 25 -- The Congress of Guatemala has just passed the so-called "Law on Expression of Thought," which, according to the official newspaper Diaro de Centro America, is "necessary to safeguard our democratic life."

docs.snippet: IT has long been felt in art circles that something ought to be done about Ralph Blakelock. There has appeared a tendency to underrate this American painter, the centenary of whose birth is now being observed. Perhaps it isn't so much that Blakelock...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT has long been felt in art circles that something ought to be done about Ralph Blakelock. There has appeared a tendency to underrate this American painter, the centenary of whose birth is now being observed. Perhaps it isn't so much that Blakelock has gone unappreciated as that we have lacked opportunities to see his accomplishment as a rounded whole.
